Description: Funerary papyrus (three fragments) containing original text partly adopted from the Book of Breathing (Parma version) written in hieratic script recto and verso.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 149-150, pls. 137-140.
Bibliographic references: Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.149-150, pls.137-140)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57819) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57819)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: creased, deposit, fractured, fragmentary, frayed, loss Black ink (faint, loss) Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair/fragmentary
